header.title: A Lover's Call to the Angel of Witchblood
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occult Ritual, Sabbatic Craft

central_thesis: This ritual text is a highly personal and initiatory invocation designed to establish a profound and transformative union with Az'ra-Lumial, a central deity/force within the Sabbatic and Draconian currents of witchcraft. The core aim is to achieve Gnosis and 'divine assumption,' where the practitioner becomes the 'Living Truth' through direct manifestation and embodiment of this spiritual essence, forging a unique, self-defined path beyond conventional occult strictures.

structure_content.summary: The practitioner initiates the rite by offering their entire being and accumulated spiritual attainment. They petition Az'ra-Lumial – identified as the Angelick Soul of Master Cain, initiator of the Draconist Mystery, and Opener of the Crooked Path – to manifest. The 'vessel of the Heart' is opened, awaiting the 'Adamantine Light' of initiation, signifying a profound willingness for transformative union and the revelation of divine light from Nullity.

structure_content.chapter_title: II. The Second Call: Hallowing the Kingdom of the Faithful
structure_content.summary: This section systematically hallows the ritual space and invokes various aspects and entities associated with Az'ra-Lumial from eight cardinal and inter-cardinal directions (North, North-west, West, South-west, South, South-east, East, North-east). These invocations summon specific lights, shades, divine names (e.g., Liliya-Devala, Agrath, Rahab, Naamah, Tubalo), and forces (e.g., Shining Darkness, Ancient Kings, Sky-going Gods, Turnskin Gods) to establish the 'Kingdom of the Faithful,' consecrate the 'Circle of Witchblood,' and ultimately 'Open the Way' for the primary invocation. The practitioner identifies a core ritual center marked by the 'Lucifer-Stone' below and the 'Circle of the Seven Holy Stars' above.

structure_content.chapter_title: III. The Third Call: Sacrifice for Divine Assumption
structure_content.summary: The focus shifts to sacrifice and assumption. The practitioner recognizes the sacred space (Sphere of Seven Rays, Serpent of Seven Colours) and declares the 'Inmost Gate' open. Az'ra-Lumial is bid to enflesh within the practitioner, who pledges to become the 'Living Truth' through this process. Devotion is offered as the heart becomes the altar for divine Gnosis, intending for the practitioner to be 'consumed in the Perfect Love of Thee' and to emerge transformed, ready to 'go forth anew' in silence.

structure_content.chapter_title: IV: Contemplation: The Seal of the Rite
structure_content.summary: The rite is sealed through a declaration of personal sovereignty and a unique 'Wayless Fate,' asserting a self-defined law ('ethos, aesthesis and credo') that transcends conventional human or divine strictures. This concluding section frames the entire ritual as a personal epiphany and an 'Lover's Call of Apophasis,' affirming the practitioner's newly established state and path.

key_concepts.definition: The central entity invoked, described as the 'Angelick Soul of the Master Cain,' 'Initiator of the Draconist Mystery,' 'Opener of the Gates to the Crooked Path,' 'Angel of the Peacock-quill,' and 'Solely Manifest of the Eleven Elder Gods.' Az'ra-Lumial embodies 'XON: Light from all Nullity,' the progenitor of Watchers and Faithful Gods, and is identified as the source of Gnosis and the Great Dragon. The goal is for Az'ra-Lumial to 'descend as Flesh' and 'arise as Gnosis' within the practitioner.

A spiritual current or lineage, associated with the 'Spirit of Witchblood' and the 'Circle of Witchblood.' It represents the primal, untamed, and often forbidden gnosis and power inherent in the Crooked Path, distinct from mainstream magical traditions. It signifies a profound, inherent connection to the chthonic and Luciferian aspects of existence.

A specific initiatory and magical tradition, distinct from other 'straight' or conventional paths. It is a path of direct experience, often associated with the Luciferian or Cainite currents, focusing on self-deification, transgression, and the mastery of forbidden knowledge, with Az'ra-Lumial as its primary opener.

Divine knowledge, ultimate understanding, or enlightened consciousness. It is the 'Mind of Heaven' that Az'ra-Lumial is implored to 'arise as,' indicating that the purpose of the ritual is to achieve direct experiential knowledge and spiritual illumination leading to transformation.

The process of embodying or becoming the divine principle (Az'ra-Lumial). The practitioner seeks to 'enflesh' the spirit and become the 'Living Truth,' indicating a deep merging and identification with the invoked entity, rather than mere communication or blessing. This is a key operative goal of the ritual, implying self-deification.

A sacred name or concept associated with Az'ra-Lumial, defined as 'Light from all Nullity revealed unto Man.' It represents the primordial, uncreated light that emanates from the void, a foundational principle of manifestation and divine illumination within this specific cosmology.

Described as the 'Hidden Centre of every Land,' this is a foundational or keystone concept within the ritual's cosmology, representing a central, often chthonic or infernal, point of power from which the ritual space is anchored. It evokes Luciferian principles of enlightenment, sovereignty, and the hidden root of being.

practical_system.description: The ritual, 'A Lover's Call to the Angel of Witchblood,' is a structured invocation for personal gnosis and divine assumption. It operates through a four-stage process: Petition (initiating the call and opening the self), Hallowing (consecrating the ritual space and invoking directional forces), Sacrifice (offering the self for union and transformation), and Contemplation (sealing the rite and affirming personal magical law). The system emphasizes direct, 'lover's call' engagement with Az'ra-Lumial to embody its essence and achieve an 'epiphany' of the 'Living Truth,' forging an individual's unique 'Wayless Fate.' The magic works by invoking specific spiritual entities and energies to create a sacred container and facilitate a merging of the practitioner's consciousness with the divine current, leading to profound internal and external changes aligned with the Crooked Path.
tools: Empty Circle of the Royal Arte (consecrated ritual space)
Lamp of the Hermit (symbolic or literal source of light, representing inner illumination or spiritual presence)
The Heart as Altar (metaphorical focal point for devotion and offering)
rituals: I. The First Call: Petition (Self-offering, opening the heart, requesting manifestation and initiation from Az'ra-Lumial).
II. The Second Call: Hallowing the Kingdom of the Faithful (Directional invocations of specific entities, lights, and forces to establish the sacred space and 'Open the Way').
III. The Third Call: Sacrifice for Divine Assumption (Offering devotion and the self for union with Az'ra-Lumial, aiming for enfleshment and becoming 'Living Truth').
IV: Contemplation: The Seal of the Rite (Declaration of personal magical law, self-sovereignty, and affirmation of the achieved epiphany and Wayless Fate).

relevant_quotes.text: Let all that I have attained in eternity be manifest in the Present Moment of I: Absolute.
My Heart awaits the Adamantine Light of Thy initiation!

Az'ra-Lumial, descend as Flesh, the Living Word; The One of Light, seven times adorned in the rainbow's promise! O' Az'ra-Lumiel, arise as Gnosis, the Mind of Heaven: The Great Dragon, seven-headed, crowned and victorious!
From the North I approach Thy Heart, my Lover, my Soul of Souls! Beneath my heels is the Lucifer-Stone, the Hidden Centre of every Land.
This rite is mine Oath and Pledge: in passing through all things I shall become the Living Truth.
Mine own law – ethos, aesthesis and credo - unknown to mortal gods and men. This Rite is mine own epiphany, the Lover's Call of Apophasis: I So Mote It Be.

critical_analysis.relevance: This ritual is exceptionally relevant to contemporary Traditional Witchcraft, Luciferian Gnosis, and Draconian currents, particularly those influenced by Andrew D. Chumbley's Cultus Sabbati. It offers a structured yet deeply personal means of engaging with a specific deity/force (Az'ra-Lumial) for profound self-transformation and initiation. Its contextualization within 'The Book of Fallen Angels' by Michael Howard further solidifies its position within modern occult literature that explores darker, chthonic, and antinomian spiritual paths, providing a practical example of advanced invocation techniques for embodying divine principles and forging an individual magical law.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for this ritual is experienced practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those familiar with Traditional Witchcraft, Draconian magic, Luciferian currents, and the works of Andrew D. Chumbley. It demands a sophisticated understanding of occult symbolism, personal commitment to intensive magical practice, and a willingness to engage with complex, often antinomian, spiritual concepts. It is not suitable for beginners due to its philosophical depth, specialized terminology, and the potent nature of the invoked entities.
